artist: Utagawa Hiroshige; Published by Sakanaya Eikichi
creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
dimension:
13 3/16 x 8 3/4 in. (33.5 x 22.3 cm) (image)
13 5/8 × 9 1/4 in. (34.6 × 23.5 cm) (sheet, vertical ōban)
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
text: Hiroshige depicted Fukagawa, Edo's lumberyard, in snow. Drying lumber leans against wooden supports in the foreground, while a canal filled with logs zigzags into the distance. The earlier edition (left) shows the scene under a pale gray, daytime sky. The darker sky of the later edition (right) suggests an evening scene or impending rain.
title: Fukagawa Lumberyards
